body: I guess the mixture of raw and non-raw methods is breaking it, but I'm not sure. Does set_raw create two copies of the thing -- one typed, one untyped?
I guess the issue is that typed_mut doesn't remove the header from the raw headers when inserting a typed one.

Ah, this is a bug. The invariants I've been enforcing are: if you get an immutable view (raw or typed), and it doesn't exist, it will generate it and then give it to you (either serializing a typed, or parsing a raw). However, if you get a mutable reference, because you can cause them to be out of sync, it should obliterate the other stored value. So, `get_mut` should kill the raw part. I believe it does this correctly when you do `headers.set(Foo)`, so it's a hole in `get_mut`.

issue.title: Kill raw part when getting mutable reference to typed header
fix(headers): Remove raw part when getting mutable reference to typed header
issue.body:
> If you get a mutable reference to a typed header it is possible to make
> the two representations be out of sync. To avoid this, after parsing the
> raw part it should be removed.
> 
> Closes #821 

Rebase with a test added.
Closes #833

issue.title: Use get_mut instead of get-remove-set in XHR send()

labels.name: E-less-complex
labels.description: Straightforward. Recommended for a new contributor.

labels.name: I-refactor
labels.description: No impact; the issue is one of maintainability or tidiness. Proposed solution requires refactoring.

labels.name: C-assigned
labels.description: There is someone working on resolving the issue

repository.name: servo
repository.description: Servo aims to empower developers with a lightweight, high-performance alternative for embedding web technologies in applications.

issue.body:
In https://github.com/servo/servo/blob/b9b289c4be50402facddd38c2ce2db2f1a05519c/components/script/dom/xmlhttprequest.rs#L637-654, we `.get()` a header, mutate it, `.remove()` it, and then `.set()` the new value. This is due to https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/821, which is now fixed.

The code should be changed to mutate in place, by calling `.get_mut()` and mutating the value directly. This also requires a bump of our hyper version.

Tests in `tests/wpt/web-platform-tests/XMLHttpRequest` should continue to pass (`./mach test-wpt --release --include tests/wpt/web-platform-tests/XMLHttpRequest`, on a release build)
